summary: A journey through the near-complete catamaran, showcasing its features and exceptional craftsmanship.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a view of a large white catamaran boat inside a spacious industrial hangar, surrounded by scaffolding and various tools, indicating ongoing maintenance or construction work. The camera pans around the boat, showcasing its sleek design and the busy environment of the hangar, with another blue and white boat visible in the background. A man wearing a white t-shirt with the text 'Ruby Rose Sailing Est. 1984' stands in front of the boat, gesturing and speaking, likely explaining the boat's features or the work being done. The camera then moves inside the boat, revealing a clean and well-lit interior with large windows, cushioned seating, and a modern design. The man continues to speak, providing insights into the boat's construction or maintenance process. The scene transitions to an underwater view, with a beam of light penetrating the dark blue water, creating a serene and mysterious atmosphere. The video concludes with the man still speaking in front of the boat, emphasizing the ongoing work and the boat's features.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker who enthusiastically welcomes the audience back to "Sailing Ruby Rose," mentioning they are close to completing the boat project and thanking viewers for their support. Transitioning smoothly into background music, with sounds reminiscent of strings and guitar, creating a pleasant, acoustic, and folky ambience. This is layered with a moderate, consistent background whirring noise, possibly from machinery or engine sounds, providing an environmental cue of being in an industrial or workshop setting.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a dark background featuring a logo that reads "RR^2 LONDON" in white, accompanied by a small drawing of a sailboat and the text "Sailing by the Sea." The scene transitions to a man wearing a light blue t-shirt with the text "Ruby Rose Sailing Est. 1944" standing in a boatyard, gesturing as he speaks. In the background, another person wearing a yellow hard hat and a blue shirt is working at a table. The man continues to speak and gesture, with the camera capturing different angles of the boatyard, including a close-up of a small window on the boat's hull labeled "Escape hatch." The video then shows a wider view of the boatyard, highlighting the large white boat with its interior visible, and concludes with a view of the boat being lifted out of the water by a crane, with the man still visible in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker explaining that they are underneath a boat and will scrape its hull. He mentions escape hatches and emphasizes that some do not open, but are break-glass emergency exits, while stating there are many things happening underneath. Then, he says that they will zip on board to show the interior. The male speaker's tone is informative and calm.

events_list.video_caption: The video takes place in a bustling boatyard, where a man wearing a light blue t-shirt with a "Ruby Pier" logo is seen speaking and gesturing animatedly. He stands in front of a large white boat with a black hull, which is supported by scaffolding and surrounded by various tools and equipment. The man appears to be explaining something, pointing towards the boat and the surrounding area. The camera then shifts to show the underside of the boat, revealing two rectangular vents on the hull. The man continues to speak, occasionally pointing to different parts of the boat and the yard. The video also captures a close-up of a storage compartment on the boat, filled with black rubber boots, and a view of the boat's interior, showcasing its white and blue color scheme. Throughout the video, the setting remains consistent, with the boatyard's industrial atmosphere and the presence of other boats and equipment in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker describing that he is "underneath port side hull number one" and then proceeds to explain that the current location has a lightning protection system. He talks about a previous time he did something similar. The speaker then states that he wants to show the current task and the reactions to it as he steps on board the boat, and that he was told to take his shoes off so he does not sully anything. He continues with a joke and then expresses that he and others on the boat all have the same style and size of shoes, so he does not know which shoes belong to whom.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a gray t-shirt with the text "Ruby Rose Sailing" is seen standing in front of a large white boat inside a spacious industrial building with metal scaffolding and a high ceiling. He appears to be explaining or discussing something related to the boat, gesturing with his hands and pointing to various parts of the boat's structure. The man's facial expressions and body language suggest he is engaged in a detailed conversation or presentation. The background shows a well-lit environment with natural light coming through the open sides of the building, highlighting the boat and the man's actions. The video captures the man's interaction with the boat, emphasizing his gestures and the details of the boat's design and features.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker who sounds informative, discussing "fire ports" on boats. He emphasizes their importance for engine fires, explaining that opening the engine hatch can worsen the fire, and a port allows for fire extinguisher use without feeding the flames. He then says, "so that's good." Following this, there is a shift as the speaker mentions exterior plugs. Throughout the clip, the background consists of ambient outdoor sounds, possibly indicative of a boat setting, which provide a sense of environmental context.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a gray t-shirt with the text "Ruby Rose Sailing Miami" printed on it, standing in a boatyard. He is seen pointing at various parts of the boat, including a red electrical box and a white wall, while explaining the features and construction of the boat. The background shows a large industrial building with scaffolding and other boats under construction. The man moves around the boat, gesturing towards different areas, such as the interior with yellow tape around the windows and the exterior with a blue and white color scheme. He demonstrates the functionality of the boat's interior, including a sink and a faucet, and provides a detailed overview of the boat's design and features. The video captures the man's enthusiasm and knowledge about the boat, as he explains its various components and the ongoing construction process in the boatyard.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip opens with a male speaker discussing "shore power," indicating he's talking about a boat or marina. The speaker transitions to describing the dinghy, saying it's the "tender of one", adding they're "in the cockpit." He then discusses what the tender looks like, saying it's a "fine boat", before briefly saying to "have another look." Then he mentions something for the "trifoil" and then the steering being all finished. The male speaker then notes, regarding the "helm speed mechanism", that he's talked about far too much. There's some discussion about moving "forward backward." He then asks rhetorically about sitting there while "having a barbecue". The male speaker encourages the listener to sit there "looking back at the world", describing it as chill. The sounds are accompanied by general boating sounds throughout, with consistent engine noise suggesting the boat is either running or nearby.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a man in a gray t-shirt with a "Ruby Red Sailing Co." logo, standing on a boat undergoing maintenance or renovation. He is seen gesturing and speaking, likely explaining the process or features of the boat. The boat's interior is partially covered with protective materials, and various tools and equipment are scattered around, indicating ongoing work. The man's attire includes a wristwatch and a microphone clipped to his shirt, suggesting he might be recording or giving a presentation. The background reveals a large industrial structure, possibly a shipyard, with scaffolding and other boats visible. The video transitions to a wider view of the boat's interior, highlighting the spacious layout with cushioned seating, large windows, and a green ceiling. The man continues to speak, occasionally pointing towards different areas of the boat, emphasizing its features. The video concludes with a focus on the boat's interior, showcasing the clean and well-lit space, with the man still present, providing further details about the boat's design and functionality.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a male speaker discussing catamaran reviews and the importance of features like a footrest and comfortable seating. The tone is informative and somewhat enthusiastic. There's a background of ambient sounds, likely from being outdoors and near a watercraft. The speaker then transitions to taking the listener inside, walking backwards to avoid blocking the light, and announcing their arrival.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases the interior of a boat under construction, with a man wearing a gray t-shirt with the text "Ruby Rose Sailing" prominently displayed. He is seen moving around the boat, gesturing and explaining various features, including a modern stainless steel sink and faucet, a wooden desk, and a bed with plastic coverings. The man appears to be discussing the boat's layout and design, pointing out different areas and explaining their functions. The background reveals a construction site with scaffolding and other boats, indicating that the boat is still in the process of being built. The video captures the man's interactions with the boat's interior, highlighting the ongoing work and the boat's features.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with sounds of speech, where a male speaker states “Here we are”. He mentions he’s tempted to move things around, assuring he’ll put it back and not to tell James. He then explains the kitchen galley, promising to put things back for James. Next, he states, “This is our galley”, although it's actually whole one’s galley. He adds that now the audience can see things they will want to see. The male speaker continues discussing cabinetry, mentions a Korean version, and comments on a tap. He talks about the tap being similar to one they have at home. He points out electric windows and how the area allows communication with the skipper. After that, he remarks on the space being huge and airy and moves to discuss a chart table and upholstery, finding it nice and comfortable. He suggests people might be sleeping there, expressing contentment with the space. Lastly, he mentions a Vietnamese worker’s reaction to him lying on the sofa and talking to the ceiling, saying he will explain later, but reiterating that this space is nice.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a view of a large white catamaran boat inside a spacious industrial hangar, featuring a high ceiling with metal beams and a concrete floor. The boat is positioned on a platform with its stern facing the camera, and a blue boat is visible in the background. The scene transitions to a close-up of a hand pressing buttons on a control panel inside the boat, with yellow tape covering parts of the panel. The camera then moves to show a wider view of the boat's interior, including a wooden door and a control panel with various switches and indicators. The interior is well-lit with natural light coming through the windows, and the camera pans around to reveal more of the boat's interior, including a wooden shelf and a small kitchen area with a sink and countertop. The video then shows a man wearing a gray t-shirt with a red logo, standing inside the boat and speaking to the camera. The man appears to be explaining or demonstrating something related to the boat's features or functionality. The video concludes with a close-up of the man's face and upper body, with the interior of the boat visible in the background, including windows and various equipment.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker in a casual tone, expressing his long-held desire to relax on a sofa on a catamaran. The scene is then interrupted by a brief boat-like horn. The speaker continues, this time in a more casual tone as he notes his need to get back to work.  He then shifts to a more enthusiastic tone. He comments on even the light switches being sexy. The description transitions to the boat’s interior, mentioning sweeping designs that will be covered with gray frosted panels, followed by a brief cough. Opening windows are mentioned, reinforcing the marine setting. As the speaker continues in the enthusiastic tone, we are invited to take a final look through the cabin, commenting on the quality and describing the scene as epic. The speaker emphasizes the amazing craftsmanship of the carpentry, noting that it's the nicest woodworking he's ever seen on a boat. The tone shifts to one of disbelief, almost as though he is discovering these amazing components for the first time. He then mentions a walk-in wardrobe he is about to enter, then notes that, because some of the shots have been dark because of nooks and crannies, he will illuminate a feature. The sounds of the clip culminate with a spotlight turning on.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a gray t-shirt with the text "Ruby Rose Sailing" sitting inside a boat under construction. He is seen gesturing and talking, with the background showing large windows and construction materials. The camera pans around the boat, highlighting wooden surfaces and the interior layout. Text overlays appear, including "SUBSCRIBE" and "TAG US @SAILINGRUBYROSE," encouraging viewers to engage with the content. The man continues to speak, providing insights into the boat's construction process, with the camera capturing various angles of the interior and exterior. The video concludes with a wider shot of the boat's interior, showcasing the ongoing construction work and the man's involvement in the project.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker recounting a past catamaran review, mentioning ventilation and joinery. He proposes a challenge to show off joinery, contrasting it with old English design boats and praising specific catamarans. He emphasizes the importance of looking at joinery at boat shows and calls for posting pictures. He expresses the hope that the viewer is enjoying the video. In the end, he is very excited and says goodbye. Throughout the speech, there is ambient boatyard noise, with intermittent periods of loud sanding or grinding noises and other tools, indicating ongoing construction work nearby. A musical interlude occurs, playing a slow, melancholic melody featuring a piano, providing a thoughtful mood. The end of the song is followed by the sound of a boat on the water.
